page.title: 17Employment: The Farrier.
page.content: ' A typical day starts at 8am. when I start work & load my car with the shoes I need for the day's work. I keep the names of all the horses on a rota system so that I know which are likely to need shoeing. I try to see the trainer to discuss the type of shoe required eg. light weight shoes for racing or longer lasting mild steel exercise shoes. I shoe a horse every month as horses feet are growing all the time. On average I shoe 40 horses every week as well as make the shoes.Sometimes I get knocked over & I often get bitten. I enjoy my work because to shoe a horse is always a challenge as you are working with living tissue and I get satisfaction in seeing a good job done. I have been a farrier for 24 yrs. I was an apprentice for 5 years.'
